The Android app makes use Salesforce SOS, which is a feature of Salesforce Service Cloud offering two-way video chat.
The druggist (licensed Customer Service representative) answering the calls works in the Lightning Console of Salesforce Service Cloud.

name: TOMS
short_description: TOMS is short for Targeted Offers Management System, an application to integrate Offers that are targeted to groups of customers.
u_detailed_description:
This Application has the potential to grow into a true Micro Service.

It offloads source systems of record from targeted Offers calls, among which Offer Engine AMS Central and SAS Campaign Management. There are multiple flavours of Targeted Offers, that are exposed via this Micro Service:

  • Activatable offers. (aka click to card, AH 'kies en activeer')
  • Activated offers. 
  • Pre-assigned personal offers.

Adding other products to your site, including but not limited to AdWords Conversion Tracking and Remarketing, DoubleClick Floodlight, and of course, Google Analytics, is a breeze.

In more detail, GTM makes your life easier by simplifying the process of adding these JavaScript snippets to your website. Google Tag Manager consists of these three main parts:

Triggers: Defines when and where tags are executed.
Variables: Used to receive or store information to be used by tags and triggers.

name: -- please remove--
short_description:
Service that receives, stores and returns the AH store customer transaction receipts ('kassabon').
Is implemented by the receipt-processor, receipt-service, the mongo database and the appie-receipt-bff.
u_detailed_description:
Service that receives a digital copy of the customer store transaction receipts ('EJ'). Stores these receipts in a database. When a customer wants to view his/her receipt in the AH App the AH App calls the 'Appie_Receipt_BFF', which calls this service that returns the receipt data.

The service has 2 components:

1. Receipt_Processor

2. Receipt_Service (data store for receipts)

The Receipt_Service stores and returns the receipts from the database.

The Receipt_Processor reads the receipts that are send by the Store PoS from the kafka queue and uses the receipt_service to store them in the database.

The Receipt_processor on request returns the receipts by reading them via the Receipt_Service from the database.

name: Demand and Capacity Dashboard
short_description: The Demand and Capacity Dashboard is a tool in which we plan ahead operationally.
u_priority_classification: Yes
u_detailed_description:
The Demand and Capacity Dashboard is a tool in which we plan ahead operationally. We predict how many orders we have customer demand for and how we expect these orders are composed in terms of number of items from different divisions. These predictions are made by data science models, we can adjust the predictions manually.

We compare the predictions with capacity for those parts of the operational process that can be a bottle neck: the Houdbaar (non-perishable) and Koel (perishable) divisions in picking as well as delivery.

Based on the prediction, we calculate how many items have to be picked in all divisions and locations and how many people we need to achieve that.

We keep track of the history of these decisions and adjustments at three crucial moments in planning: 

  • 12 weeks ahead (when we can decide to hire new production or delivery staff)
  • 6 weeks ahead (when we set up the initial schedule) 
  • 1 week ahead (when we still can make adjustments to the schedule)

Service that receives, stores and returns the AH store customer transaction receipts ('kassabon').
Is implemented by the receipt-processor, receipt-service, the mongo database and the appie-receipt-bff.
u_detailed_description:
Service that receives a digital copy of the customer store transaction receipts ('EJ'). Stores these receipts in a database. When a customer wants to view his/her receipt in the AH App the AH App calls the 'Appie_Receipt_BFF', which calls this service that returns the receipt data.

The service has 2 components:

1. Receipt_Processor

2. Receipt_Service (data store for receipts)

The Receipt_Service stores and returns the receipts from the database.

The Receipt_Processor reads the receipts that are send by the Store PoS from the kafka queue and uses the receipt_service to store them in the database.

The Receipt_processor on request returns the receipts by reading them via the Receipt_Service from the database.
